subsection.name: 1.1.2 Support for 'generated' columns
subsection.p: Some databases support "auto increment" or "identity" columns. Such columns are normally used for auto-generation of primary keys at the database level. Support for them (and even term used for this feature) varies across RDBMS.

In 1.2 Cayenne DbAttribute (i.e. table column descriptors) has a new boolean property - "generated". It tells Cayenne that a column value is expected to be set on the database during INSERT. In addition this information is used by DbAdapter to still allow the values generated on the client to be saved in such columns. E.g. SQLServerAdapter implements special handling of INSERT queries for tables that have identity columns.
